page.title: 16GUILTHWAITE GRANGE
page.content: { Guilthwaite Grange was originally built in 1760 but it was fully restored in 1972 by the present owner. The out buildings were built in the fourteenth century and many of the original beams and walls can be seen. The house is set in two acres of land. Fruit trees grow in the garden,many of which are cider apple trees,planted by the previous owner.Also growing in the garden is an apple-pear tree the fruit of which tastes like an apple and looks like a pear. The house was almost completely re-built when the present owners bought the farm building.At present it has fourteen large and attractive rooms.Across the kitchen ceiling is a large wooden beam.This is not the original one because that rotted away.
